result.execSummary:
The defendant Laice J. Firkus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber granted for employment and any counseling she may be involved in.
Sentence to commence today. 
May be served in Portage County or Waukesha County.
Submit DNA Sample if not already done so.

ADDRESS INFO for Laice J. Firkus
Current: PO Box 0217, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53187 United States  (Effective: 01-24-2022)
Prior: 702 Portage Street, Stevens Point, WI 54482
from Defendant

Defendant Laice J. Firkus in court, in custody Waukesha County Jail.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Laice J. Firkus.  Judge Zell appears in person as well. 

11:14 AM Court calls case.
Atty Jambois states appearances.

This matter was scheduled for a jury trial next week, then a hearing was set today. 
Parties have come to a resolution.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 will be dismissed and read in. 
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Court did receive a letter today, from Defendant, had to do with entering a plea and didn't want to go to trial.
Court shares the letter with the parties.
Defendant concurs, explains.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 2: No Contest. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2, contrary to the statute section stated therein.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read in. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim has received full restitution.
Victim is not present.

Atty Jambois makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Jakobson makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
Count 2: 
Jail sentence for 30 days.
Huber granted for employment and any counseling she may be involved in.
Sentence to commence today. 
May be served in Portage County or Waukesha County.
Pay costs and surcharges.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample if not already done so. 

20 days in which to appeal.
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
